/*# sourceMappingURL=data:application/json;base64, */</style><script type="text/javascript" src="https://static.zdassets.com/ekr/snippet.js?key=web_widget/backblaze.zendesk.com" charset="utf-8" async="" id="ze-snippet"></script><script>
	function setupMobileNoScroll() {
    resizeNav();
    const menuBtn = document.querySelector(".nav2_menubtn");
    const menuBtnObserver = new MutationObserver((ms) => {
      ms.forEach((m) => {
        if (m.target.classList.contains("nav2_menubtn")) {
          resizeNav();
          if (m.target.classList.contains("w--open")) {
            document.body.classList.add("no-scroll");
          } else {
            document.body.classList.remove("no-scroll");
          }
        }
      });
    });
    menuBtnObserver.observe(menuBtn, {
      attributes: true,
      attributeOldValue: true,
      attributeFilter: ["class"],
    });
  }

  function resizeNav() {
    const mainNav = document.querySelector("#Nav2_Main");
    const mainNavSpacer = document.querySelector("#Nav2_MainNavContentSpacer");
    const mainNavRect = mainNav.getBoundingClientRect();
    const alertPrimary = document.querySelector("#alert-primary");
    const alertPrimarySpacer = document.querySelector(
      "#Nav2_PrimaryAlertContentSpacer"
    );
    const navMenu = document.querySelector(".nav2_menu");
    const navMenuOverlay = document.querySelector(".w-nav-overlay");
    let navMenuH = window.innerHeight - mainNavRect.height;
    let navMenuY = mainNavRect.height;

    mainNavSpacer.style.height = `${mainNavRect.height}px`;

    if (alertPrimary) {
      const alertPrimaryRect = alertPrimary.getBoundingClientRect();
      alertPrimarySpacer.style.height = `${alertPrimaryRect.height}px`;
      navMenuH -= alertPrimaryRect.height;
      navMenuY += alertPrimaryRect.height;
    }

    if (window.innerWidth > 991) {
      navMenu.style.height = "auto";
    } else {
      navMenu.style.height = `${navMenuH}px`;
      navMenuOverlay.style.setProperty("top", `${navMenuY}px`, "important");
    }
  }

  window.addEventListener("resize", resizeNav);
	
  function handleSignInLanguage() {
    const isBzSignedIn = document.cookie.indexOf("bzsignedin") > -1;

    const signedInElementWrapper = document.querySelector(".nav2_iconlink_signin");
    signedInElementWrapper.classList.toggle("is-signed-in", isBzSignedIn);

    const signedInElement = document.querySelector(".naviconlink_label-signin");
    signedInElement.textContent = isBzSignedIn ? "My Account" : "Sign In";
    signedInElement.classList.toggle("is-signed-in", isBzSignedIn);
    
    const signedInMobileElement = document.querySelector('.nav2_link.signin');
  	signedInMobileElement.textContent = isBzSignedIn ? "My Account" : "Sign In";
  }
  
  // Workaround for Devlink compatibility
	window.setTimeout(() => {
  	handleSignInLanguage();
    setupMobileNoScroll();
  }, 1000);

</script><script>
// MKTGWEB-1756
function updateYearInFooter() {
    const currentYear = new Date().getFullYear();

    const footer = document.querySelector('#footer, #footer-content');

    function updateYearText(node) {
        if (node.nodeType === Node.TEXT_NODE) {
            const yearPattern = /\d{4}/g;
            node.textContent = node.textContent.replace(yearPattern, match => {
                return parseInt(match, 10) !== currentYear ? currentYear : match;
            });
        } else {
            node.childNodes.forEach(updateYearText);
        }
    }
    if (footer) {
        updateYearText(footer);
    }
}

updateYearInFooter();
</script></head>
<body class=""><div></div>
  
  

  <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin="">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=DM+Sans:wght@400;500;700&amp;display=swap">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://f001.backblazeb2.com/file/backblaze-com-assets/headerAndFooter/devlink-global.css">
<script>
    $(window).trigger('page:loaded');
</script>

        window.Bz.HeaderPrimary.render({
          id: "header-content",
        });
  			window.Bz.FooterLight.render({
          id: "footer-content",
        });
      });
</script>

  	display: none;
  }

  	pointer-events: none;
  }

  	margin: 0;

    display: block;
    visibility: hidden;
    opacity: 0;
    transform: scale(.95);
    transition: margin .2s, visibility .2s 0s, opacity .2s, transform .2s;
  }

  	margin-top: 9px;
    visibility: visible;
    opacity: 1;

    transform: scale(1.0);
    transition: margin .2s, visibility 0s 0s, opacity .2s, transform .2s;
  }

  	margin-top: 0px;

  	opacity: 1;
  }

  	opacity: 0;

  	height: 80px;

}

@media (max-width:991px) {
	.w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle,
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list {
  	/*transition: background-color .15s;*/
    background-color: #fff;
  }
	.w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle.w--open,
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list.w--open {
  	background-color: #F5F4FF;
  }
 
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle,
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list {
  	/*transition: background-color .15s;*/
  }

  .w-dropdown .nav2_dropdownlinklabel {
  	transition: color .15s;
  }
  .w-dropdown-toggle.w--open .nav2_dropdownlinklabel {
  	color: #3430FF;
	}
  .w-dropdown-list.w--open {
  	/*padding-bottom: 15px;*/
  }
     .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-link,
   .nav2_dropdowntoggle {
  	padding-top: 13px !important;
    padding-bottom: 13px !important;
  }
  
  
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle {
  	background-color: transparent;
    border-top-left-radius: 10px;
    border-top-right-radius: 10px;
    border-bottom: none;
  }
   .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list {
   	background-color: transparent;
    border-radius: 0px;
    border-bottom-left-radius: 10px;
    border-bottom-right-radius: 10px;
   }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle.w--open,
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle[aria-expanded="true"] {
  	background-color: #E6E3FF;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown {
  	padding-right: 10px;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list.w--open {
  	background-color: #E6E3FF;
    position: relative;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown {
  	padding-right: 10px !important;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-icon-dropdown-toggle {
  	margin-right: 10px !important;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle.w--open,
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-toggle[aria-expanded="true"] {
  	background-color: #F5F4FF;
  }
  .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown .w-dropdown-list.w--open {
  	background-color: #F5F4FF;
    position: relative;
  }
  .dropdownarrow {
  	transition: transform .15s;
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }	
  .w-dropdown-toggle.w--open > .nav2_dropdownarrow {
  	transform: rotate(180deg);
  }
  .nav2_dropdownarrow.m-on {
  	display: block !important;
  }	
 
  .w-nav-menu {
  	top: 0px !important;
    overflow-y: scroll;
    background-color: #fff;
  }

  .w-nav-overlay {
  	transition: background-color .2s;
    background-color: transparent;
    position: fixed !important;
  }
  .w-nav-overlay [data-nav-menu-open] {
  	background-color: #fff;
  }
}

 .navlinkaux {
  	width: 20px;
    position: relative;
    width: 17px;
    transition: width .15s;
  }
  .navlinkaux_label {
  	opacity: 0;
  }
  .navlinkaux:hover .navlinkaux_label {
  	opacity: 1;
  }
  
  .nav2_menubtn_label {
  	transition: .15s;
  }
  .nav2_menubtn_label-menu {
  	opacity: 1;
  }
	.nav2_menubtn_label-close {
  	opacity: 0;
  }
  .nav2_menubtn.w--open .nav2_menubtn_label-menu {
  	opacity: 0;
  }
  .nav2_menubtn.w--open .nav2_menubtn_label-close {
  	opacity: 1;
  }

	.nav2_menubtn_icon_line {
  	transition: .15s;
    opacity: 1;
    background-color: #333;
    transition: background-color .15s, transform .15s;
  }
  
  .nav2_menubtn:hover .nav2_menubtn_icon_line {
  	background-color: #3430ff;
  }	

	.nav2_menubtn.w--open .nav2_menubtn_icon_line1 {
  	transform: rotate(45deg);
    opacity: 1;
    top: 9px;
  }
  .nav2_menubtn.w--open .nav2_menubtn_icon_line2 {
  	opacity: 0;
    width: 0;
  }
  .nav2_menubtn.w--open .nav2_menubtn_icon_line3 {
  	transform: rotate(-45deg);
    opacity: 1;
    top: 9px;
  }
  
  @media (min-width: 992px) {
    .nav2_iconlink_signin.is-signed-in:hover {
      width: 110px;
    }
    .naviconlink_label-signin.is-signed-in {
      width: 110px;
      right: -10px;
      left: unset;
    }
  }
</style></div><div class="nav2_content nav2_content-fixed"><div class="nav2_main" id="Nav2_Main"><div class="nav2_main_container" id="Nav2_Main_Container"><a href="https://www.backblaze.com/" <path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M14.5077 19.3916C14.1172 19.7821 13.484 19.7821 13.0935 19.3916C12.703 19.0011 12.703 18.3679 13.0935 17.9774L18.0712 12.9996H3.51489C2.96261 12.9996 2.51489 12.5519 2.51489 11.9996C2.51489 11.4473 2.96261 10.9996 3.51489 10.9996H18.0709L13.0935 6.02217C12.703 5.63165 12.703 4.99848 13.0935 4.60796C13.484 4.21743 14.1172 4.21743 14.5077 4.60796L21.1772 11.2775C21.3672 11.4595 21.4855 11.7157 21.4855 11.9996C21.4855 12.1697 21.443 12.3299 21.368 12.4702C21.3287 12.5439 21.2795 12.6137 21.2204 12.6777C21.2111 12.6878 21.2015 12.6978 21.1918 12.7075M21.1918 12.7075L14.5077 19.3916Z" fill="#ffffff"></path>
</svg></div></a><div class="div-block-113"></div><a href="https://www.backblaze.com/get-started" class="cta cta-solid cta-solid-red w-inline-block" nam="cta"><div class="cta-label cta-label-white">Start Free</div><div class="cta-arrow-white-svg-embed cta-arrow w-embed"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M14.5077 19.3916C14.1172 19.7821 13.484 19.7821 13.0935 19.3916C12.703 19.0011 12.703 18.3679 13.0935 17.9774L18.0712 12.9996H3.51489C2.96261 12.9996 2.51489 12.5519 2.51489 11.9996C2.51489 11.4473 2.96261 10.9996 3.51489 10.9996H18.0709L13.0935 6.02217C12.703 5.63165 12.703 4.99848 13.0935 4.60796C13.484 4.21743 14.1172 4.21743 14.5077 4.60796L21.1772 11.2775C21.3672 11.4595 21.4855 11.7157 21.4855 11.9996C21.4855 12.1697 21.443 12.3299 21.368 12.4702C21.3287 12.5439 21.2795 12.6137 21.2204 12.6777C21.2111 12.6878 21.2015 12.6978 21.1918 12.7075M21.1918 12.7075L14.5077 19.3916Z" fill="#ffffff"></path>
</svg></div></a></div></nav><div aria-label="menu" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="menu" aria-controls="w-nav-overlay" role="button" tabindex="0" class="nav2_menubtn w-nav-button"><div><div class="navbar_menubtn_icon"><div class="nav2_menubtn_icon_line1 nav2_menubtn_icon_line"></div><div class="nav2_menubtn_icon_line3 nav2_menubtn_icon_line"></div><div class="nav2_menubtn_icon_line2 nav2_menubtn_icon_line"></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="nav2_contentspacer-mainnav nav2_contentspacer" id="Nav2_MainNavContentSpacer" style="height: 80px;"></div><div class="nav2_js w-embed"><script>
	function setupMobileNoScroll() {
    resizeNav();
    const menuBtn = document.querySelector(".nav2_menubtn");
    const menuBtnObserver = new MutationObserver((ms) => {
      ms.forEach((m) => {
        if (m.target.classList.contains("nav2_menubtn")) {
          resizeNav();
          if (m.target.classList.contains("w--open")) {
            document.body.classList.add("no-scroll");
          } else {
            document.body.classList.remove("no-scroll");
          }
        }
      });
    });
    menuBtnObserver.observe(menuBtn, {
      attributes: true,
      attributeOldValue: true,
      attributeFilter: ["class"],
    });
  }

  function resizeNav() {
    const mainNav = document.querySelector("#Nav2_Main");
    const mainNavSpacer = document.querySelector("#Nav2_MainNavContentSpacer");
    const mainNavRect = mainNav.getBoundingClientRect();
    const alertPrimary = document.querySelector("#alert-primary");
    const alertPrimarySpacer = document.querySelector(
      "#Nav2_PrimaryAlertContentSpacer"
    );
    const navMenu = document.querySelector(".nav2_menu");
    const navMenuOverlay = document.querySelector(".w-nav-overlay");
    let navMenuH = window.innerHeight - mainNavRect.height;
    let navMenuY = mainNavRect.height;

    mainNavSpacer.style.height = `${mainNavRect.height}px`;

    if (alertPrimary) {
      const alertPrimaryRect = alertPrimary.getBoundingClientRect();
      alertPrimarySpacer.style.height = `${alertPrimaryRect.height}px`;
      navMenuH -= alertPrimaryRect.height;
      navMenuY += alertPrimaryRect.height;
    }

    if (window.innerWidth > 991) {
      navMenu.style.height = "auto";
    } else {
      navMenu.style.height = `${navMenuH}px`;
      navMenuOverlay.style.setProperty("top", `${navMenuY}px`, "important");
    }
  }

  window.addEventListener("resize", resizeNav);
	
  function handleSignInLanguage() {
    const isBzSignedIn = document.cookie.indexOf("bzsignedin") > -1;

    const signedInElementWrapper = document.querySelector(".nav2_iconlink_signin");
    signedInElementWrapper.classList.toggle("is-signed-in", isBzSignedIn);

    const signedInElement = document.querySelector(".naviconlink_label-signin");
    signedInElement.textContent = isBzSignedIn ? "My Account" : "Sign In";
    signedInElement.classList.toggle("is-signed-in", isBzSignedIn);
    
    const signedInMobileElement = document.querySelector('.nav2_link.signin');
  	signedInMobileElement.textContent = isBzSignedIn ? "My Account" : "Sign In";
  }
  
  // Workaround for Devlink compatibility
	window.setTimeout(() => {
  	handleSignInLanguage();
    setupMobileNoScroll();
  }, 1000);

</script></div><div class="w-nav-overlay" id="w-nav-overlay" style="display: none; width: 0px; height: 5915px;"></div></div></div>
            </div>

        </section>
    




    
        <section id="knowledge" class="section section--padding knowledge knowledge--type-2">
            <div class="container" data-plugin-knowledge="{&quot;type&quot;: 2 }">
                <div class="row">

                    
                    <nav class="col--md-5 col--lg-up-4 knowledge__nav js-tabs-links">
                        
                            <a href="#knowledge-202640058" class="knowledge__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <h3 class="categories__title">
                                    <span>Backblaze Personal Backup</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </h3>
                                
                            </a>

                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </h3>
                                
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#knowledge-202640068" class="knowledge__nav-link" tabindex="0">

                                    <span>Backblaze B2 Cloud Storage</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </h3>
                                
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#knowledge-1260801622949" class="knowledge__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <h3 class="categories__title">
                                    <span>Website and Account help</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </h3>
                                
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#knowledge-360000383054" class="knowledge__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <h3 class="categories__title">
                                    <span>Privacy &amp; Security</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </h3>
                                
                                    <p class="categories__description is-hidden--sm-down js-spoiler">
                                        <span>This section covers questions regarding the privacy of the data our customers store with us and the data we collect from customers.</span>
                                    </p>
                                
                            </a>
                        
                    </nav>

                    
                    <div class="col--md-7 col--lg-up-8 categories-col">
                        <div class="categories js-tabs-containers">
                            
                                <div id="knowledge-202640058" class="categories__category js-knowledge-category is-open">

                                                    <div class="sections__item">
                                                        <a href="/hc/en-us/sections/203997268-Backing-Up"><h3 class="categories__title">Backing Up</h3>
                                                        </a>
                                                        <p class="categories__description">Backblaze will back up your computer without having you pick folders and files. The default setting is to backup continuously whenever you computer is on.</p>

                                                        
                                                        <div class="row articles articles--simple">
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/12552680767131-How-to-only-backup-select-folders" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        How to only backup select folders
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/7276976850203-How-to-backup-OneDrive-on-Mac" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        How to backup OneDrive on Mac
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/4404148070043-Why-is-my-Veracrypt-software-preventing-my-drive-from-backing-up" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        Why is my Veracrypt software preventing my drive from backing up?
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/1260801522390-Box-Drive-files-cannot-be-backed-up-by-Backblaze-on-Mac" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        Box Drive files cannot be backed up by Backblaze on Mac
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360058426913-Will-Backblaze-back-up-iCloud-Drive-on-Mac" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        Will Backblaze back up iCloud Drive on Mac?
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360056554794-Will-Backblaze-backup-the-iCloud-drive-on-Windows" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        Will Backblaze backup the iCloud drive on Windows?
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            

                                                            
                                                                <div class="col articles__more">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/sections/203997268-Backing-Up" class="btn btn--sm btn--primary">

                                                    <div class="sections__item">
                                                        <a href="/hc/en-us/sections/114094005313-FAQ"><h3 class="categories__title">FAQ</h3>
                                                        </a>
                                                        <p class="categories__description">Frequently Asked Questions</p>

                                                                    </a>

                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">
                                                                    <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/1260803271729-Enabling-Server-Side-Encryption-on-B2-Cloud-Storage" class="articles__link  ">
                                                                        Enabling Server-Side Encryption on B2 Cloud Storage
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">

                                                                        Server-Side Encryption FAQ
                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            
                                                                <div class="col--lg-up-6">

                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>

                                                                    </a>
                                                                </div>
                                                            

                                                            
                                                        </div>

                                                <p class="categories__description">
                                                    This section covers questions regarding the privacy of the data our customers store with us and the data we collect from customers.
                                                </p>

            <div class="row">

                            </a>

                                <span>How to Create a Restore from Your Backblaze Backup</span>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>

                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-115000015273" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">

                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>

                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-360022330274" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <span>Locating the Master Application Key and Master Application Key ID Pair</span>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-12948855824283" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <span>Quickstart Guide for Veeam 12 Direct-to-Cloud Backups to Backblaze B2 with Immutability </span>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-360052973274" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">

                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>

                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-360010017893" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">
                                <span>Delivering Private Backblaze B2 Content Through Cloudflare CDN</span>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                            </a>
                        
                            <a href="#promoted-360002004214" class="promoted__nav-link" tabindex="0">

                            </a>

                    <div class="promoted__body is-hidden--sm-down tabs__containers js-tabs-containers" style="">
                        
                            <div id="promoted-360004553833" class="tabs__container is-active" aria-hidden="false">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Disabling The "Locate My Computer" Feature </h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <p>Backblaze can help recover your lost computer or stolen laptop by tracking it, if and when it connects to a network again. However, if you prefer not to grant Backblaze access to your computer's location, the feature can be disabled.</p>
<p>To disable this feature at the account level, log into your account <a href="https://secure.backblaze.com/user_signin.htm">here</a> and click the Locate My Computer link on the left side of the page. Click the "Turn Off" button on the right side to disable this feature and stop all tracking.</p>
<p>Once this feature has been disabled at the account level, each Backblaze installation registered to the account will automatically disable its own location services functions, so long as version <span>7.0.1.452 or newer is installed. The latest version of the Backblaze Online Backup installer is always <a href="https://secure.backblaze.com/update.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">available here</a>. These settings changes may take some time to be picked up by each installation.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/14270767361819" alt="turnofflocatemycomputer.png" width="651" height="357"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360004553833-Disabling-The-Locate-My-Computer-Feature" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-227807447" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Backblaze Maintenance Schedule</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <p>The Backblaze Maintenance Schedule page can be found here:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.backblaze.com/scheduled-maintenance.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://www.backblaze.com/scheduled-maintenance.html</a></p>
<p>Backblaze has a maintenance window scheduled every <br><strong>Thursday</strong> from: <strong>11:3</strong><strong>0am - 1:30pm Pacific Time</strong>.</p>
<p>During this time the following services may be unavailable: making a new purchase, installing new trials, signing in to your account, creating new accounts, enabling B2, and creating a master Key.</p>
<p>Please note the following B2 calls may also be affected: b2_create_bucket, b2_delete_bucket</p>
<p>Most other parts of the service will remain unaffected. <br><br>We expect maintenance to be completed by <strong>1:30pm Pacific Time.</strong>&nbsp;If the maintenance window needs to be extended, please keep an eye on our Twitter account during the maintenance window for updates: <a href="https://twitter.com/backblaze" target="_blank" rel="noopener">@Backblaze</a>. For longer planned maintenance, updates will be posted to the <a href="https://www.backblaze.com/blog/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Backblaze Blog</a> prior to the maintenance taking place.&nbsp;</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/227807447-Backblaze-Maintenance-Schedule" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-360000457154" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Unable to install - Installer must be run as Administrator</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <p>If you are on Windows and you are trying to install Backblaze and you are running into the error:&nbsp;</p>
<p><img src="/hc/article_attachments/360000494654/mceclip0.png"></p>
<p>1. You will need to save the file to disk.</p>
<p>2. Right-click the saved file.</p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="/hc/article_attachments/360024075813/mceclip1.png" width="277" height="206"></p>
<p>3. From the menu choose, Run as Administrator.</p>
<p><img src="/hc/article_attachments/360000494814/mceclip1.png"></p>
<p>This will start the installer properly.</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360000457154-Unable-to-install-Installer-must-be-run-as-Administrator" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-217666588" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Two Factor Verification</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2>&nbsp;</h2>
<h2>Backblaze Accounts &amp; Two Factor Verification&nbsp;</h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Backblaze supports two-factor verification via the TOTP (Time-based One Time Password) app of your choice, such as Authy or Google Authenticator or via SMS (Short Message Service aka text message) to a single phone number registered to the account. Please note that the SMS option is only available after the first account payment is successfully processed (typically after 30 days)</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>As fallback options, ten one-time use codes can be generated and saved securely, such as in a password manager, safe, or your preferred secure document storage system. For accounts using a TOTP app, SMS is supported as an optional fallback as well.&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>Note: Accounts using SSO (Single Sign-On) will not have 2FV options available.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h2><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">To enable Two Factor Verification for the first time, follow these steps:&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></h2>
<p>1. <a href="https://secure.backblaze.com/user_signin.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Sign in to the Backblaze website</a> with your current account email address and password.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>2.&nbsp; Once signed in, select "My Settings" from the left-side navigation links.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/6136576635035/signinsettings.png" alt="signinsettings.png" width="589" height="593"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>3. Select the "Sign In Settings" link on the right side of the My Settings page.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<p>4. On the following pane, change the Two Factor Authentication option to "On" and all of the options to enable and configure fallback 2FV options will be available, as shown below.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4506480418587/b2signinsettings.png" alt="b2signinsettings.png" width="450" height="628"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>6. If you choose SMS and leave the Generate Backup Codes option checked and click Update, it will show you a list of 10 backup codes you can use to regain access to your account in the future, should the primary 2FV method be inaccessible. Save or print these codes and keep them in a safe place. Once done, you will be logged out of your account automatically.&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>Note: SMS will only be available if a phone number has already been registered to the account via the My Settings page.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>8. If you choose Authentication Application, open your preferred Authentication Application and scan the QR code shown for your account. Enter the verification code presented in the app and click Verify. It will tell you below that field if it was successful. You also have the option to Allow fallback to SMS, which is enabled by default. This will allow you to have a verification code sent to your verified phone number if you lose your Authentication Application. You can then click Update to save the settings. If you left the Generate Backup Codes option checked, it will show you a list of 10 backup codes you can use to regain access to your account in the future if you lose access to your phone number. Save or print these codes and keep them in a safe place. Once done, you will be logged out of your account automatically.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>9. When you log back in, you will see the below screen after you enter your password if you chose SMS. You can click the switch from Off to On to have your current browser trusted, so you won't be asked again for the SMS verification code in that browser. You will still be asked for the code in other browsers or on other devices. You have the option to select Resend Code if you have trouble receiving the SMS code, or click Use Backup Code to enter one of the 10 backup codes you saved previously.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4403207865115/2fv4.png" alt="2fv4.png"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>10. If you chose Authentication Application, you will see this screen instead. You can click the switch from Off to On to have your current browser trusted, so you won't be asked again for the Authentication Application verification code in that browser. You will still be asked for the code in other browsers or on other devices. You have the option to select Send SMS Fallback Code to your verified phone number if you have lost access to your Authentication Application, or you can select Use Backup Code to enter one of the 10 backup codes you saved previously.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4403207869723/2fv5.png" alt="2fv5.png"></p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/217666588-Two-Factor-Verification" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-217666508" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Settings Overview (Win)</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2>Backblaze Settings Overview (Win)</h2>
<p>To open the Backblaze Control Panel, you can use either the Start Menu entry or the System Tray icon.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>If Backblaze has been pinned to your main Start Menu pane, it will appear as on the left below. If it has not, you can find it in the "All Programs" selection, as shown to the right below.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/attachments/token/5VkJnTfSut7yPn60IEPpNnL8X/?name=Start+Menu.png" alt="Start_Menu.png" width="411" height="517">&nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="/attachments/token/rTALJ0T1FaI8p8nCTsPEty1qZ/?name=Start+Menu+2.png" alt="Start_Menu_2.png"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The system tray icon is typically found at the lower right hand side of your desktop area, just to the left of the clock. Below is an example of the default desktop area with the system tray icons highlighted.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/attachments/token/2OGAHlxRDQp1W9zmxa6oUHCDr/?name=Desktop.png" alt="Desktop.png" width="821" height="462"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Here is a close view of the System Tray and the Backblaze icon and the menu that appears if you select the Backblaze icon:&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/1260800046989/unnamed__2_.png" alt="unnamed__2_.png"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/1260800047009/unnamed__1_.png" alt="unnamed__1_.png"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Once you have opened the Backblaze Control Panel, you will see a screen like that shown below.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/8328779474075/control_panel_with_username.png" alt="control_panel_with_username.png" width="651" height="540"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 120px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<strong>"Backup Now"</strong>&nbsp;button will either resume or initiate a backup, depending on your backup schedule settings.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<strong>"Restore Options"</strong>&nbsp;button will present you with basic information about the way in which you can restore files from your Backblaze backup.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Selected for Backup"</strong>&nbsp;reports the total number and size of all of the files currently included in your Backblaze backup.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Backup Schedule"</strong>&nbsp;indicates the current schedule setting of your Backblaze software.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Remaining Files"</strong>&nbsp;shows the total number and size of files currently in queue to be uploaded. These files are not yet backed up.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<strong>"Settings"</strong>&nbsp;button will take you to the various settings you can change for the Backblaze backups. For more information on each settings pane, please refer to one of the following articles:&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666518-General-Settings-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">General Settings (Win)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666478-Performance-Settings-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Performance Settings (Win)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666488-Schedule-Settings-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Schedule Settings (Win)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666538-Exclusions-Settings-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Exclusion Settings (Win)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666498-Security-Settings-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Security Settings (Win)</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/217666508-Settings-Overview-Win" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-217666248" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Settings Overview (Mac)</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2>Backblaze Settings Overview (Mac)</h2>
<p>There are a few ways to open Backblaze Preferences, depending on what version of macOS you are running. You will find a screenshot of each below.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Only users on <strong>macOS 10.12-10.15</strong> can find the application through the System Preferences pane:</h3>
<p>To access your System Preferences pane, select the "" menu from the top left-hand side of your screen and select the "System Preferences" selection from the associated drop-down menu. It can also be accessed from the "Applications" section of "Finder"</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/1260802494049/systemprefmac.png" alt="systemprefmac.png" width="456" height="454"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h3>&nbsp;Users of all macOS versions can open Backblaze Preferences via either the menu bar icon or the Applications folder.</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The menu bar icon will typically be found at the top right-hand side of your screen, to the left of your system clock.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<img src="/attachments/token/32j1zYbtI2kBnajad0sfS0cBe/?name=Menu+Bar+Icon.png" alt="Menu_Bar_Icon.png"></p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p>Here you will find the Backblaze application file shown in the Applications directory.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/8329777786139/findbackblaze2.png" alt="findbackblaze2.png" width="649" height="445"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Once you have opened the Backblaze Preferences pane, you will see the screen pictured below:&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/8329824149659/preferences_with_username.png" alt="preferences_with_username.png" width="650" height="480"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The <strong>"Backup Now"</strong> button will either resume or initiate a backup, depending on your backup schedule settings.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The <strong>"Restore Options"</strong> button will present you with basic information about the way in which you can restore files from your Backblaze backup.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Selected for Backup"</strong> reports the total number and size of all of the files currently included in your Backblaze backup.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Backup Schedule"</strong> indicates the current schedule setting of your Backblaze software.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>"Remaining Files"</strong> shows the total number and size of files currently in the queue to be uploaded. These files are not yet backed up.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The <strong>"Settings"</strong> button will take you to the various settings you can change for the Backblaze backups. For more information on each settings pane, please refer to one of the following articles:&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><a title="General Settings (Mac)" href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666278-General-Settings-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">General Settings (Mac)</a></p>
<p><a title="Backblaze Performance Settings (Mac)" href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666258-Performance-Settings-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Performance Settings (Mac)</a></p>
<p><a title="Schedule Settings (Mac)" href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666288-Schedule-Settings-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Schedule Settings (Mac)</a></p>
<p><a title="Exclusions Settings (Mac)" href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666298-Exclusions-Settings-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Exclusions Settings (Mac)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666268-Security-Settings-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Security Settings (Mac)</a></p>
<p><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666308" target="_self">Reports (Mac)</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/217666248-Settings-Overview-Mac" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-217665888" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>How to Create a Restore from Your Backblaze Backup</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2 id="01H84SY4K6PQSZK4N3CX8RYSBE">Creating a Restore:&nbsp;</h2>
<p>To start, you will need to <a href="https://secure.backblaze.com/user_signin.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">sign in to the Backblaze website</a> with your registered email address and password.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/8700201221019" alt="newsigninpage.png" width="650" height="439"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp;</p>
<h2 id="01H84SY4K7FKTKGWY686CZCYK8">Selecting the Backup:</h2>
<p>Once logged in, you will be brought to the account Overview page. On this page, all of the computers registered for backup under your account are shown with some basic information about each. Select which backup from which you wish to restore data by using the appropriate "Restore" button.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4448905706651" alt="overviewpagerestore.png" width="601" height="444"></p>
<h2 id="01H84SY4K7EHJ5FM5S4KJ8SGZV">Selecting the Type of Restore:&nbsp;</h2>
<p><br>Backblaze offers three different ways in which you can receive your restore data: downloadable zip file, Save Files to B2, or USB hard drive. The downloadable zip restore option will create a zip file of the files you request that is made available for download for 7 days. Zip restores do not have any additional cost and are a great option for individual files or small sets of data. Depending on the speed of your internet connection to the Backblaze data center, downloadable restores may not always be the best option for restoring very large amounts of data. Zip restores are limited to 500 GB per request and a maximum of 20 active requests can be submitted under a single account at any given time.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The Save Files to B2 option allows you to move a zip restore to our B2 Cloud Storage service for permanent storage. The Save Files to B2 option will quote your estimated storage cost, to find out more about the costs of B2 see the B2 pricing page <a href="https://www.backblaze.com/cloud-storage/pricing">here</a>. The maximum size of a Save Files to B2 restore is 10TB. You can learn more <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015521773-Saving-Files-to-B2-from-Computer-Backup" target="_self"><strong>here</strong>.</a></p>
<p>USB hard drive restores are built with the data you request and then shipped to an address of your choosing. We ship via FedEx with signature required where available. FedEx does not deliver to PO Boxes. <span>All USB restores are prepared and shipped from the U.S., even if your data is stored in a non-U.S. data center.</span></p>
<p>USB hard drive restores cost $189 and can contain up to 8 TB max (7,000,000 MB of data). This includes the cost of shipping.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> If you are ordering a Mac restore drive that you plan on using and accessing through a Windows computer, please follow <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/360055138334" target="_self">this guide</a> to ensure the drive is formatted correctly for Windows.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4449043114395" alt="selectrestoremethod.png" width="600" height="497"></p>
<h2 id="01H84SY4K7Z40TCTDPQ6AEPGVB">Selecting Files for Restore:&nbsp;</h2>
<p>Using the left hand file viewer, navigate to the location of the files you wish to restore. You can use the disclosure triangles to see subfolders. Clicking on a folder name will display the folder's files in the right hand file viewer. If you are attempting to restore files that have been<strong> <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217665868-Restoring-Deleted-or-Previous-Versions-of-Files" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">deleted or are otherwise missing</a></strong>&nbsp;<em>or</em> files from a <strong><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217665878-Restoring-Data-from-Secondary-or-External-Hard-Drives" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">failed or disconnected secondary or external hard drive</a></strong>, you may need to change the timeframe parameters.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Put checkmarks next to disks, files or folders you'd like to recover. Once you have selected the files and folders you wish to restore, select the "Continue with Restore" button above or below the file viewer. Backblaze will then build the restore via the option you select (zip or usb drive). You'll receive an automated email notifying you when the zip restore has been built and is ready for download&nbsp;<strong>or</strong> when the usb restore drive ships.&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you are using the downloadable zip option, and the restore is over 2 GB, we highly recommend using the Backblaze Downloader for better speed and reliability. We have a guide on using the Backblaze Downloader for<strong> <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217665908-How-to-Use-the-Backblaze-Downloader-Mac-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Mac OS X here</a></strong>, or for<strong> <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217665918-How-to-Use-the-Backblaze-Downloader-Win-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Windows here</a></strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/360040922153" alt="Screen_Shot_2019-07-01_at_3.58.40_PM.png" width="644" height="735"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;"><em><strong>Please note: </strong>You can now apply filters to your view on the "View/Restore Files" page</em></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center" style="padding-left: 90px;"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/1260800805949" alt="filefilters.jpeg"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>You now have the option of applying the following filters to your file view on the "View/Restore Files" page. The options are:</p>
<p><strong>1. Show hidden Files:</strong> This will display data normally hidden from the default view</p>
<p><strong>2. Files Backed Up in the Last Week:</strong> This will display only files backed up in the last week</p>
<p><strong>3. Files Accumulated in Forever Version History:</strong> Please note, if your back is set to any other version history besides Forever Version history, this option <strong>will not</strong> appear for you.</p>
<p>&nbsp;( you can find out more about our Extended Version History options <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035247494" target="_self">here</a> )</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h2 id="01H84SY4K79SQPZAX6T1ZFSDC0">What to do after you have created your restore:</h2>
<h3 id="01H84SY4K77K6DJCAWCZBZ9XXC">If you have selected a .zip (download) restore:</h3>
<p>Once you have created a restore, our restore servers will begin preparing the files you requested. &nbsp;When the restore is ready to be downloaded, you will receive an email notification. &nbsp;Then you can go to&nbsp;https://secure.backblaze.com/user_signin.htm to login in to your account, and select '<strong>My Restores</strong>'.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;<img src="/attachments/token/1tIBrkzbOmqfjhkL7KglytQUQ/?name=Screen+Shot+2015-07-31+at+3.45.33+PM.png" alt="Screen_Shot_2015-07-31_at_3.45.33_PM.png" width="843" height="394"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4410590048411" alt="myrestorespage__1_new.png"></p>
<p>This will show you all of your restores available for download. &nbsp;</p>
<p>We would recommend selecting '<strong>Use Downloader' for all restores over 1 GB,</strong>&nbsp;which will download the&nbsp;<strong>Backblaze Downloader</strong>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>Once the zip restore has been downloaded to your computer, you will need to unzip the folder to access the restored files. If you are on a Windows computer, you can use the unzipper built into the Backblaze Downloader. If you are on a Mac, you can use the unzipper built into the OS.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>*Note</strong> -&nbsp;For best results on large restores, we recommend breaking up your restore into multiple chunks as shown <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217665828-How-can-I-create-a-smaller-restore-or-pick-and-choose-what-s-in-my-restore-" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">here</a>.</p>
<h3 id="01H84SY4K7VVRMPH2NY4FF9PBK">If you have selected a USB Hard Drive Restore:</h3>
<p>You will want to follow the packaged instructions that come bundled with your drive, detailing how to install the appropriate unlocking software, and inputting the unlock code from your "My Restores" page. The steps for how to unlock your Encrypted drive <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/221865708-How-to-unlock-an-encrypted-USB-restore" target="_self">can be found in this guide</a>.</p>
<p>In both instances, either downloading a .zip, or accessing your encrypted drive, you would then drag and drop the files from the restore to the appropriate areas of your computer.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><em><span class="s1">Please note: all restore drives are formatted to the operating system of the computer the restore was created from.</span></em></strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/217665888-How-to-Create-a-Restore-from-Your-Backblaze-Backup" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-115000015273" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>FAQs for Backblaze for Business Prior to January 18th, 2017</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The following is a collection FAQs for customers using Backblaze for Business prior to January 18th, 2017 and who have not yet migrated to the new Backblaze for Business. Please see the <a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000014334">Migration FAQ</a> for on migrating. &nbsp;</span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h5><span class="wysiwyg-font-size-large"><strong>Installing &amp; Getting Started</strong></span></h5>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441548-What-is-the-difference-between-IT-and-Individual-Access-?_ga=1.10333493.1862960565.1444939625"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What is the difference between IT and Individual Access?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441578-Does-Backblaze-Have-a-Silent-Installer-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Does Backblaze Have a Silent Installer?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441598-Why-is-My-Custom-Installer-Asking-My-Users-for-A-Password-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Why is My Custom Installer Asking My Users for a Password?</span></a></li>
</ul>
<h5><span class="wysiwyg-font-size-large"><strong>Licensing</strong></span></h5>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441528-How-Do-I-Add-Additional-Licenses-to-my-Backblaze-for-Business-Account-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How Do I Add Additional Licenses to my Backblaze for Business Account?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96447647-Transfer-Backup-State-for-Backblaze-for-Business"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Transfer Backup State for Backblaze for Business</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441518-How-Do-I-Remove-A-Backup-from-My-Business-Account-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How Do I Remove A Backup from My Business Account?</span></a></li>
</ul>
<h5><span class="wysiwyg-font-size-large"><strong>Common Questions</strong></span></h5>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96447767-What-is-a-Usage-Report-and-Why-are-They-Important-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What is a Usage Report and Why are They Important?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441608-Why-Am-I-Getting-Out-of-Compliance-Emails-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Why Am I Getting "Out of Compliance" Emails?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/entries/96441508-How-Do-I-Renew-My-Backblaze-for-Business-Account-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">How Do I Renew My Backblaze for Business Account?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666838-What-Does-client-not-seen-Mean-"><span style="font-weight: 400;">What Does ‘Client Not Seen’ Mean?</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><a href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666828-How-Do-I-Change-the-Email-Address-Domain-Associated-With-My-Business-Account-">How do I Change the Email Address/Domain Associated w/ my Account?</a></li>
<li><a style="background-color: #ffffff;" href="https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666818-Inherit-Backup-State-for-Backblaze-for-Business">Inherit Backup State for Backblaze for Business</a></li>
</ul>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/115000015273-FAQs-for-Backblaze-for-Business-Prior-to-January-18th-2017" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-360022330274" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Locating the Master Application Key and Master Application Key ID Pair</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <p>The Master Application Key ID for an account can be found at the top of the 'App Keys' page of the Backblaze website, once signed into the Backblaze website. See the below screenshot.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The Master Application Key is only shown when generating it and is not shown again, so make sure you save this in a secure location if you plan on using this more than once.&nbsp;</p>
<p>On the same page, non-master app key and app key ID pairs can also be generated with specific access rights.&nbsp;</p>
<p>For a detailed look, the documentation for app keys and app key IDs can be found here:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.backblaze.com/b2/docs/application_keys.html">https://www.backblaze.com/b2/docs/application_keys.html</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/4408894609307/applicationkeyspage.png" alt="applicationkeyspage.png" width="600" height="502"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<p>NOTE: The terminology for the Master Application Key ID was recently changed from being called the Account ID. If you are using an integration where the terminology has not been updated to reflect our change, the Master Application Key ID will work in place of the Account ID. For a non-master app key that has been created, you can use that key's keyID in place of an Account ID.</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360022330274-Locating-the-Master-Application-Key-and-Master-Application-Key-ID-Pair" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-12948855824283" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Quickstart Guide for Veeam 12 Direct-to-Cloud Backups to Backblaze B2 with Immutability </h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2>Welcome</h2>
<p>With the release of Veeam Backup and Replication Version 12 comes the ability to tier your Veeam Backup Jobs directly to B2 Cloud Storage.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This guide will walk you through Backblaze buckets and keys, how to set up an S3 Compatible Object Storage Repository pointing to your Backblaze B2 bucket with Immutability, and assigning that repository to a new Backup Job.&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you would like to set up your B2 Cloud Storage bucket as a part of a Scale-out Backup Repository, or are running either Veeam Version 10 or Veeam 11, please see this guide: <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/360046959734" target="_self">Quickstart Guide for offloading Veeam Cloud Tier backups to Backblaze B2 with immutability</a></p>
<p>A 12 minute walk-through guide is also available below:&nbsp;</p>
<p><div class="iframe" style="padding-bottom: 56.25%;"><iframe src="//www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/eSsKgwDRw4k" allowfullscreen="" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0"></iframe></div></p>
<h2>Part 1: Setting up Your Backblaze Account</h2>
<p>Begin this guide by signing in to your Backblaze account. If you do not have an account, please sign up <a href="https://www.backblaze.com/business-veeam-backup-create.html#cloudtier" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here.</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>1) Click Create a Bucket</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947422860699" alt="d2c-1-buckets.png" width="500" height="310"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">2) Give your bucket a valid name, enable Object Lock, then click "Create a Bucket".&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947422838811" alt="d2c-2-create-bucket.png" width="500" height="370"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">3) Confirm your bucket has been made. Leave the File Lifecycle setting at the default "Keep all versions" Make note of your Endpoint, this will be useful when setting up your repository.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">Ex: in this case, the endpoint is "s3.us-east-005.backblazeb2.com"</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432021659" alt="d2c-3-see-buckets.png" width="499" height="369"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">4) Navigate to the App Keys page. Click the "Add a New Application Key" button.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432038043" alt="d2c-4-app-key-page.png" width="500" height="370"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">5) Give your key a valid name, leave all other settings on default, then click "Create New Key".&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423019291" alt="d2c-5-create-app-key.png" width="499" height="369"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">6) Record your keyID and applicationKey. You'll use them to set up your repository.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947881565723" alt="d2c-6-show-app-key.png" width="500" height="370"></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h2>Part 2: Adding your Backup Repository</h2>
<p>1) Open Veeam Backup &amp; Replication 12.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12948362548891" alt="veeam1.png"></p>
<p>2) Navigate to Backup Infrastructure, then click Add Repository.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423099035" alt="d2c-7-add-repo.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">3) Click Object storage.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432277531" alt="d2c-8-object-storage.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">4) Click S3 Compatible.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423165339" alt="d2c-9-s3-compatible.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">5) Fill out the Name and Description fields, then click Next.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423271707" alt="d2c-10-name-repo.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">6) Fill out the Service point field with your Bucket Endpoint. Fill out the Region field with the 2nd part of the Endpoint. Then click Add...&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423284251" alt="d2c-11-servicepoints.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">7) Fill out the Access key and Secret key fields with your keyID and applicationKey, respectively. Then click OK.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423319579" alt="d2c-12-enter-keys.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">8) Confirm your B2 credentials on the Account window, then click Next.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432501659" alt="d2c-13-confirm-creds.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">9) Click the Browse... button to the right of the Bucket field.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423412379" alt="d2c-14-browse-bucket.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">10) Select your bucket, then click OK.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432583195" alt="d2c-15-select-bucket.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">11) Click the Browse... button to the right of the Folder field.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423470107" alt="d2c-16-browse-folder.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">12) Click New Folder.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432686235" alt="d2c-17-new-folder.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">13) Type a name for your new folder. Press the Enter key to accept the name. Then click OK.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423572635" alt="d2c-18-MyBackups-folder.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">14) Check the box to select "Make recent backups immutable for x days", set your preferred number of days, then click Next.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left"><em>Note: This is a required step in this guide due to Object Lock being enabled in the example bucket. Checking this box is how one enables Veeam Immutability for their backups. Backblaze strongly recommends using this feature to protect your data from ransomware.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432746011" alt="d2c-19-objectlock.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">15) Proceed through the Mount Server, Review, and Apply screens without making changes. Then click Finish on the Summary page.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423750427" alt="d2c-19d-summary-finish.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">Congratulations! Your Repository is finished. Find it in the Backup Repositories section of your Backup Infrastructure. When you are ready, proceed to the next section to make your Backup Job.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947432970907" alt="d2c-20-highlight-repo.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center">&nbsp;</p>
<h2 class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">Part 3: Creating a Direct-to-Cloud Backup Job&nbsp;</h2>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>1) Navigate to Home -&gt; Jobs.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433029915" alt="d2c-21-jobs.png"></p>
<p>2) Click Backup Job, then click Virtual machine...</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423911451" alt="d2c-22-click-vms.png"></p>
<p>3) Fill out the Name and Description fields, then click Next.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433115675" alt="d2c-23-name-job.png"></p>
<p>4) Click Add...</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947423962779" alt="d2c-24-add-vm.png"></p>
<p>5) Browse your VMs and make your selection(s). Click Add when finished. Repeat as necessary.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947424012187" alt="d2c-25-select-vms.png"></p>
<p>6) Confirm the selections, then click Next.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433187483" alt="d2c-26-confirm-vms.png"></p>
<p>7) Use the Backup repository drop-down to find and select your Backblaze B2 Backup repository.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947424080923" alt="d2c-27-choose-repo.png"></p>
<p>8) Click Advanced...</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947424091547" alt="d2c-28-click-advanced.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-left">9) Navigate to the Storage tab. Use the Storage optimization drop-down to find and select 4MB. Then click OK.&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>Note: This is optional, but will improve performance of object storage backups to Backblaze B2 Cloud Storage.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433324955" alt="d2c-29-storage-4mb.png"></p>
<p>10) Confirm the selections, Click Next.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947424152731" alt="d2c-30-confirm-storage.png"></p>
<p>11) Proceed through the Guest Processing window without making changes. On the Schedule page, click "Run the job automatically" and set a schedule. Then click Apply.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433429531" alt="d2c-31-scheduling.png"></p>
<p>12) Optionally click the "Run the job when I click Finish" box, then click Finish.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433500059" alt="d2c-32-job-summary.png"></p>
<p>Congratulations! Your Direct-to-Cloud Backup Job to Backblaze B2 with Immutability is finished. Thanks for following along.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-center"><img src="/hc/article_attachments/12947433536155" alt="d2c-33-finish.png"></p>
<p class="wysiwyg-color-black wysiwyg-font-size-medium wysiwyg-text-align-left">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-color-black wysiwyg-font-size-medium wysiwyg-text-align-left">Again, Backblaze strongly recommends all Veeam customers enable Object Lock in Backblaze B2 and Immutability in Veeam to protect against ransomware. If you have a valid reason for not protecting against ransomware and do not want to enable immutability, please contact our support team for detailed instructions on how this can be enabled.</p>
<p class="wysiwyg-color-black wysiwyg-font-size-medium wysiwyg-text-align-left">If you have any questions about B2, please feel free to reach out to our Support Team via our website here:&nbsp;<span class="wysiwyg-color-blue90 wysiwyg-underline"><a href="https://www.backblaze.com/help.html">https://www.backblaze.com/help.html</a></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <a href="/hc/en-us/articles/12948855824283-Quickstart-Guide-for-Veeam-12-Direct-to-Cloud-Backups-to-Backblaze-B2-with-Immutability" class="btn btn--primary promoted__body-btn">
                                    <span>Read more</span>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-right is-hidden--rtl"></i>
                                    <i class="fas fa-chevron-left is-hidden--ltr"></i>
                                </a>
                            </div>
                        
                            <div id="promoted-360052973274" class="tabs__container" aria-hidden="true">
                                <div class="promoted__body-container">
                                    <h2>Object Lock FAQs</h2>
                                    <div data-article-body="" data-plugin-article-body="">
                                        <h2 class="wysiwyg-text-align-justify"><span class="wysiwyg-color-black">What is Object Lock?</span></h2>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-justify"><span class="wysiwyg-color-black"> Object Lock is a feature that makes data immutable by preventing a file from being changed or deleted until a given date. This helps to protect files stored in Backblaze B2 Cloud Storage from threats like ransomware which could potentially encrypt or remove files you intend to keep. </span></p>
<h2 class="wysiwyg-text-align-justify"><span class="wysiwyg-color-black">How does Object Lock work?</span></h2>
<p class="wysiwyg-text-align-justify"><span class="wysiwyg-color-black"> Object Lock can be enabled on a bucket at the time the bucket is created or at a later date. For files going into a bucket with Object Lock enabled, there are two ways to lock them. First, you can set a date when you upload the file as part of the call to our API. Second, you can set a date on a file that is already uploaded. For both methods, you must set a date to lock the file until and which mode you want to use. Attempts to delete the file or make any changes to it before the set date will fail. While you can use the second method to extend the lock on a file, you cannot use it to shorten the lock. </span></p>
